00109 {
00110   struct timeval current_time;
00111   int elapsed, remaining;
00112 
00113   if (start_time.tv_sec == 0)
00114     return 0;
00115 
00116   gettimeofday (&current_time, NULL);
00117   elapsed = current_time.tv_sec - start_time.tv_sec;
00118   remaining = total - loaded;
00119   return (remaining * elapsed) / loaded;
00120 }

GSList* collect_nvts ( const char *  folder,
const char *  subdir,
GSList *  files 
)

Collects all NVT files in a directory and recurses into subdirs.

Parameters:
folder The main directory from where to descend and collect.
subdir A subdirectory to consider for the collection: "folder/subdir" is thus the effective directory to descend from. "subdir" can be "" to make "folder" the effective start.
files A list that is extended with all found files. If it is NULL, a new list is created automatically.
Returns:
Parameter "files", extended with all the NVT files found in "folder" and its subdirectories. Not added are directory names. NVT files are identified by the defined filename suffixes.

Definition at line 64 of file pluginload.c.

00065 {
00066   GDir *dir;
00067   const gchar *fname;
00068 
00069   if (folder == NULL)
00070     return files;
00071 
00072   dir = g_dir_open (folder, 0, NULL);
00073   if (dir == NULL)
00074     return files;
00075 
00076   fname = g_dir_read_name (dir);
00077   while (fname)
00078     {
00079       char *path;
00080 
00081       path = g_build_filename (folder, fname, NULL);
00082       if (g_file_test (path, G_FILE_TEST_IS_DIR))
00083         {
00084           char *new_folder, *new_subdir;
00085 
00086           new_folder = g_build_filename (folder, fname, NULL);
00087           new_subdir = g_build_filename (subdir, fname, NULL);
00088 
00089           files = collect_nvts (new_folder, new_subdir, files);
00090 
00091           if (new_folder)
00092             g_free (new_folder);
00093           if (new_subdir)
00094             g_free (new_subdir);
00095         }
00096       else if (g_str_has_suffix (fname, ".nasl"))
00097         files = g_slist_prepend (files,
00098                                  g_build_filename (subdir, fname, NULL));
00099       g_free (path);
00100       fname = g_dir_read_name (dir);
00101     }
00102 
00103   g_dir_close (dir);
00104   return files;
00105 }

void init_loading_shm (  ) 

Definition at line 130 of file pluginload.c.

00131 {
00132   int shm_key;
00133 
00134   if (loading_shm)
00135     return;
00136 
00137   shm_key = rand () + 1;
00138   /*
00139    * Create shared memory segment if it doesn't exist.
00140    * This will be used to communicate current plugins loading progress to other
00141    * processes.
00142    * loading_shm[0]: Number of loaded plugins.
00143    * loading_shm[1]: Total number of plugins.
00144    */
00145   loading_shmid = shmget (shm_key, sizeof (int) * 2, IPC_CREAT | 0600);
00146   if (loading_shmid < 0)
00147     perror ("shmget");
00148   loading_shm = shmat (loading_shmid, NULL, 0);
00149   if (loading_shm == (void *) -1)
00150     {
00151       perror ("shmat");
00152       loading_shm = NULL;
00153     }
00154   else
00155     bzero (loading_shm, sizeof (int) * 2);
00156 }
